reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed this nice little hotel, and it's very pleasant english speaking owner. It is a two star, and perhaps a little rough around the edges, but very clean with a modern new bathroom. If you are driving, finding it can be a challenge. Use Viamichelin or Mappy and carefully map out a route through the maze of one way streets before you go. This worked for us. The map on the website is of little use.
reviews.title: Nice place, very central location
great base to explore
reviews.text: The owner has a deal with a nearby parking garage for overnite parking, 10 euros/night. To get this price you must find the parking office in the garage, and go in there to pay with your ticket stamped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights in the Hotel Des Carmes in Rouen during September and can only describe our stay as a sleepless miserable existence for 48 hours.
reviews.title: Really Awful

reviews.text: First of all, we arrived around noon and went straight to check in so we could drop off our luggage and do some sight-seeing. At no point were we ever informed that you can’t actually check in til 4.30. When eventually we were able to check in we found the gentleman on reception to be very nice, he spoke excellent English, and the lobby area was quite pretty however that was the only charm factor about this place.
reviews.title: Convenient, great service, impeccable, cozy. Downside: Noisy
Good value, not fancy
reviews.text: We booked a double room with an en suite bathroom. The room was disgusting with 80’s décor and it felt filthy. The headboards of the bed had a velvet texture but looked disgusting, there was no way I was going to sit up and read in this bed! The bathroom had a dirty greyish brown carpet and was sticky. I thought it was extremely unhygienic to have a carpet in a bathroom. The door into the bathroom was very dirty but nothing that a good scrub with soap and water wouldn't sort out. Why this hadn't been cleaned was beyond me. Our room was on the first floor overlooking the square, a word of warning, do not book a room at the front of this hotel! We could not sleep til after 5 am each morning with the noise from the square. The hotel does not have a staff presence during the night, guests are given a code on arrival which you must use to access the premises. I can’t say I felt very safe in our room, the front door, while accessible only by code, didn’t look or feel very secure.
This hotel really should fall into the hostel category; I’m astonished that it has a 2 star hotel rating. I could not recommend this hotel in any way and was counting down the hours to leaving.
reviews.title: Super hotel!

reviews.text: Spent a night with family in two triple rooms. Great service -just remember to phone if arriving past 8pm. We were lucky and found a parking spot right in front of the hotel, otherwise you have to walk three blocks to the hotel de ville parking garage, which is nice because you go through beautiful streets and then find the breathtaking cathedral.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in great city centre location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the heart of the old city. Right besides the cathedrals and all major monuments.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a night there during our trip in France and it was great. Very clean, nice little breakfast, friendly management staff.
reviews.title: hotel des carmes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Charming little hotel in great location

likes.liked: — Location, outlook from room, the owner (helpful, spoke good English), convenient parking (in a medieval city this is a big plus!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very convenient parking at the Hotel de Ville. Only costs 5Euros per night if you get your ticked stamped at the hotel.
reviews.title: Charming!

likes.disliked: — Breakfast good but a bit pricey at 7.30 euro each.

reviews.text: A lovely hotel with a great location very central with a very quaint family atmosphere. Excellently managed by a very hospitable french bilingual couple with a lovely breakfast also
reviews.title: Worth a visit
